docs.lead_paragraph: MOST of the excitement in the baseball world during 1967 was caused by the Boston Red Sox, who won the American League pennant on the final day of the season after finishing ninth in the 10team league the two preceding years. One would assume that these two books would supplement each other nicely.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tim Wakefield earned his 200th career win in an 18-6 pounding of Toronto that ended Boston’s five-game skid and provided some more breathing room in the wild-card race.

docs.lead_paragraph: Raul Ibanez hit a homer in the ninth to force extra innings, and his game-winning single in the 12th helped give the Yankees a one-game lead over the Orioles before the season’s final day.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees defeat Boston Red Sox, 4-3, in 12 innings; Yankees designated hitter Raul Ibanez comes up big twice, giving the team a chance to finish the regular season with the best record in the American League.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bobby Valentine, the animated and ever-scheming manager of the Boston Red Sox, tossed his gum in disgust. He stomped back to the dugout, face flushed, having been ejected over a controversial call on a bunt foul tip by Will Middlebrooks in the 10th inning of a tie game with the Yankees. In the clubhouse, though, Valentine may have winked. He certainly smiled when, two batters later, shortstop Pedro Ciriaco blooped a single into right field for the go-ahead run to help Boston sneak out of Yankee Stadium with a 3-2 win Sunday night.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox take ten innings to defeat the New York Yankees, 3-2. Photo (M)
docs.snippet: For the second straight game, Pedro Ciriaco delivered a late hit to propel the Red Sox over the Yankees, this time with a bloop single in the 10th inning against reliever Dave Robertson....

headline.main: With Another Hit, Unlikely Star Swings Series Boston's Way

docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees effort to advance in the wild-card race suffered a demoralizing blow after Mariano Rivera allowed a tying run in the ninth, and Jacoby Ellsbury scored in the 10th.
